# Contribute to PlantSeg

PlantSeg is an open-source project, and we welcome contributions from the community. There are many ways to contribute, such as writing tutorials or blog posts, improving the documentation, submitting bug reports and feature requests, or writing code that can be incorporated into PlantSeg itself.

## Getting Started

To set up the development environment, run:

```bash
mamba env create -f environment-dev.yml
conda activate plant-seg-dev
```

To install PlantSeg in development mode, run:

```bash
pip install -e . --no-deps
```

## Coding Style

PlantSeg uses _Ruff_ for linting and formatting. _Ruff_ is compatible with _Black_ for formatting. Ensure you have _Black_ set as the formatter with a line length of 120.

## Before Submitting a Pull Request

### Run Tests with `pytest`

Ensure that `pytest` is installed in your conda environment. To run the tests, simply use:

```bash
pytest
```

### Check Syntax with `pre-commit`

The PlantSeg repository uses pre-commit hooks to ensure the code is correctly formatted and free of linting issues. While not mandatory, it is encouraged to check your code before committing by running:

```bash
pre-commit run --all-files
```

Commit messages are important. Please follow the [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) specification.

For efficiency, pytest is not included in the pre-commit hooks. Please run the tests separately.
A tool for cell instance aware segmentation in densely packed 3D volumetric images

[PlantSeg](plantseg) is a tool for cell instance aware segmentation in densely packed 3D volumetric images.
The pipeline uses a two stages segmentation strategy (Neural Network + Segmentation).
The pipeline is tuned for plant cell tissue acquired with confocal and light sheet microscopy.
Pre-trained models are provided.

The PlantSeg repository is organised as follows: 
* **plantseg**: Contains the source code of PlantSeg.
* **conda-reicpe**: Contains all necessary code and configuration to create the anaconda package.
* **docs**: Contains the documentation of PlantSeg.
* **evaluation**: Contains all script required to reproduce the quantitative evaluation in
[Wolny et al.](https://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.57613).
* **examples**: Contains the files required to test PlantSeg.
* **tests**: Contains automated tests that ensures the PlantSeg functionality are not compromised during an update.

# Installation

## Prerequisites for Conda package

* Linux, Windows, macOS (not all features are available on macOS)
* (Optional) Nvidia GPU with official Nvidia drivers installed for GPU acceleration

## Install Mamba

The easiest way to install PlantSeg is by using the [conda (Anaconda)](https://www.anaconda.com/) or
[mamba (Miniforge)](https://mamba.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html) package manager. We recommend using `mamba` because it is faster and usually more consistent than `conda`.

=== "Linux"

    To download Miniforge open a terminal and type:

    ```bash
    curl -L -O "https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Miniforge3-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh"
    bash Miniforge3-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh
    ```

    Then install by typing:

    ```bash
    bash Miniforge3-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh
    ```

    and follow the installation instructions.
    Please refer to the [Miniforge repo](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge) for more information, troubleshooting and uninstallation instructions.
    The miniforge installation file `Miniforge3-*.sh` can be deleted now.

=== "Windows/macOS"
    The first step required to use the pipeline is installing mamba. The installation can be done by downloading the installer from the [Miniforge repo](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge). There you can find the download links for the latest version of Miniforge, troubleshooting and uninstallation instructions.

## Install PlantSeg using Mamba

PlantSeg can be installed directly by executing in the terminal (or PowerShell on Windows). For `conda` users, the command is identical, just replace `mamba` with `conda`.

=== "Linux/Windows"

    * NVIDIA GPU version, CUDA=12.x

        ```bash
        mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c nvidia -c conda-forge pytorch pytorch-cuda=12.1 pyqt plant-seg --no-channel-priority
        ```

    * NVIDIA GPU version, CUDA=11.x

        ```bash
        mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c nvidia -c conda-forge pytorch pytorch-cuda=11.8 pyqt plant-seg --no-channel-priority
        ```

    * CPU version

        ```bash
        mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c nvidia -c conda-forge pytorch cpuonly pyqt plant-seg --no-channel-priority
        ```

=== "macOS"

    * Apple silicon version

        ```bash
        mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c conda-forge python=3.11 pytorch::pytorch pyqt plant-seg --no-channel-priority
        ```

If you used older versions of PlantSeg, please delete the old config files in `~/.plantseg_models/configs/` after installing new PlantSeg.

The above command will create new conda environment `plant-seg` together with all required dependencies.

Please refer to the [PyTorch](https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/) website for more information on the available versions of PyTorch and the required CUDA version. The GPU version of Pytorch will also work on CPU only machines but has a much larger installation on disk.

## Optional dependencies

If you want to use the headless mode of PlantSeg, you need to install `dask[distributed]`:

```bash
conda activate plant-seg
mamba install dask distributed
```

Some types of compressed tiff files require an additional package to be load correctly (e.g.: Zlib, ZSTD, LZMA, ...).
To run PlantSeg on those stacks, you need to install `imagecodecs`.
In the terminal:

```bash
conda activate plant-seg
pip install imagecodecs
```

Experimental support for SimpleITK watershed segmentation has been added to PlantSeg version 1.1.8.
These features can be used only after installing the SimpleITK package:

```bash
conda activate plant-seg
pip install SimpleITK
```

Please go to the [documentation](https://kreshuklab.github.io/plant-seg/chapters/getting_started/installation/) for more detailed instructions. In short, we recommend using `mamba` to install PlantSeg, which is currently supported on Linux and Windows.

* GPU version, CUDA=12.x (replace `12.1` with `11.8` for CUDA=11.x)

    ```bash
    mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c nvidia -c conda-forge pytorch pytorch-cuda=12.1 plant-seg --no-channel-priority
    ```

* CPU version

    ```bash
    mamba create -n plant-seg -c pytorch -c nvidia -c conda-forge pytorch cpuonly plant-seg --no-channel-priority
    ```

The above command will create new conda environment `plant-seg` together with all required dependencies.

result.description:
## What's Changed
* New export widget by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/341
* Fix perfomance on mac by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/337
* Fix voxel size unit by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/343


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/compare/2.0.0a2...2.0.0a3
result.name: 2.0.0a3

result.description:
## What's Changed

### Features

* feat(pred): check and free VRAM for prediction with oversized patch  by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/272
* Automatic patch shape recommendation by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/302
* Compute best patch and halo shapes by default, reduce user effort by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/307
  * Fix size finder and widgets for 2D UNet by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/313
* Add un-/re-do and save-/load-states for proofreading tool by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/323

### Infrastructure & GUI

and recover after infra refactor

* Unify and standardise logging in PlantSeg v2 by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/296
* Add important widgets and improve logger further by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/297
* PlantSeg.Core: `ModelZoo`, `PlantSegImage`, and `VoxelSize` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/298
* Tests: Fix all existing tests by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/299
* Test and refactor `.core` and `functionals.dataprocessing` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/303
* Properly refresh ComboBox choices with functions by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/305
* Make VoxelSize iterable and array-like, remove `.is_valid` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/310
* refactor: use `magicgui.types.Separator` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/311
* Improve model filters | Use RadioButtons | Custom modality by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/314
* Group widgets for batch `.hide()`/`.show()` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/317
* Fix and integrate lifted multicut widget into agglomeration widget by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/328
* Refactor and recover widgets: cropping and label processing by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/330
* PlantSeg v2: Final polishment of GUI by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/326
* refactor(GUI): rename and reorder widgets for intuitive sequential flow by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/331
* PlantSeg v2: full codebase refactor with unified task framework, enhanced prediction/proofreading, and metadata handling by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/285


### Bug fixes

* fix(cropping): use RangeSlider to fix #278 | handle `None` image by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/279
* fix(widget-IO): temp fix #282 and auto generate layer name by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/304
* Fix TIFF default layer name and hide key widget by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/312
* Fix and document distance transform watershed for 2D pmaps/images  by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/318
* fix h5 export by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/335
* fix: avoid reading logo file from docs folder by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/336

### CI/CD

* Use `pre-commit` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/263
* chore: migrate from `bumpversion` to `bump-my-version` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/266
* chore(pre-commit): add conventional commits by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/267
* fix(installation): remove old configs if `KeyError` | macOS installation by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/277
* fixes PlantSeg crash on apple silicon #273 by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/275
* Use Codecov by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/300
* Fix version related issues: bump version, comparison and Anaconda upload by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/333

### Docs

* fix: links in docs, docstring warning and theme override by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/269
* fix(docs): teach Qt to find napari icons by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/271
* PlantSeg v2 docs base by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/320
* Recover and document over-/under-seg fix by nuclei by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/321
* PlantSeg v2: Finalise docs by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/322
* Record issue missing button by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/327




## New Contributors
* @pre-commit-ci made their first contribution in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/265

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/compare/1.8.0...2.0.0-alpha
result.name: 2.0.0a2

result.description:
## What's Changed

* 🏠 PlantSeg was moved to https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/

### Features

* 🦒 **Execute PlantSeg-compatible models in [🦒 BioImage.IO Model Zoo 🐿️](https://bioimage.io)** by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/247 & https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/248
* 📏 **Refactor rescaling widget** | Rearrange widgets by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/249
  * Improve use of `Enum` as widget choices and fix types by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/256
* 🤖 **Recommend users a halo for U-Nets** by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/252

### Documentation

* Doc: Data/models, train/add new models, Jupyter Book remnant by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/240
* **Doc: API and screenshots** by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/249
  * Doc: Fix docs build in CI  by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/257
  * Doc: Fix and update rescaling widget screenshot docs by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/259
* Doc: Add revision date and committer plugins by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/260

### Tests

* Tests for rescaling widget by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/258

### Bug Fix

* Type Fix: `np.array` is not a type, change to `np.ndarray` by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/231
* Fix Legacy GUI after v1.7.0 by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/237
* Fix `CYX`/`CZYX` pad/halo, fix `io.zarr`/tests, fix typing, refactor model load by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/233
* Headless: Handle multi-channel prediction output and add docs by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/239
* Test Fix: always-skipped test and misleading name by @qin-yu in https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/pull/262

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/kreshuklab/plant-seg/compare/1.7.0...1.8.0

## What's Changed

* 🥳 PlantSeg is on conda-forge as `plant-seg` at [anaconda.org/conda-forge/plant-seg](https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/plant-seg)
* 📖 PlantSeg documentation is published at [hci-unihd.github.io/plant-seg/](https://hci-unihd.github.io/plant-seg/)

### Bug Fix

* Fix multi-channel output layers in Napari by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/184
* Fix halo implementation and tiling artefact by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/220 & https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/223
* Fix voxel size precision and font size in Napari GUI by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/227

### Features

* New `key` & `channel` selection for all interfaces by @qin-yu @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/165, https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/184 & https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/212
* Add option to set home_path via PLANTSEG_HOME env-variable. by @tibuch in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/170
* Add support for training by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/159
* Add Lifted MultiCut in GUI by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/184
* Add option to only run official models in "Try all Available Models" by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/207
* Add widget: remove objects using a probability map by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/202
* Add validation, adaptation and halo to prediction widgets by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/211
* Add widget managers and rearrange tabs by @lorenzocerrone @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/221 & https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/227

### Models

* Ensure compatibility with models trained with pytorch-3dunet by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/160
* Add a generic nuclear model for GoNuclear paper by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/169 & https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/193
* Central model records by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/216

### Documentation

* Improve docs and create website at https://hci-unihd.github.io/plant-seg/ by @qin-yu in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/179, https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/191, https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/229 & https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/230
* Update mamba install by @jackyko1991 in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/180

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/compare/1.6.0...1.7.0

## New Maintainer

* @qin-yu became a maintainer 

## New Contributors
* @qin-yu made their first contribution in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/165
* @tibuch made their first contribution in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/170
* @jackyko1991 made their first contribution in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/180

## What's Changed
* Move models to zenodo by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/135
* Improved proofreading by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/132
* Fix incorrect model weights on Zenodo by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/139
* Minor UI improvements by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/137
* Remove pytorch-3dunet dependency by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/141
* Improve batch_size selection by @wolny in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/147
* Better models names by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/148
* Add nice widgets callbacks by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/149
* Read write zarrs by @Mohinta2892 in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/150
* Add zarr support by @lorenzocerrone in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/151

## New Contributors
* @Mohinta2892 made their first contribution in https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/pull/150

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/hci-unihd/plant-seg/compare/1.5.2...1.6.0
result.name: Overall improvements and bug fixes

result.description:
Major plantseg update! 
What's new: 
- A new interactive plantseg mode using [napari](https://napari.org/stable/index.html) as a viewer!
- build-in segmentation proofreading
- New experimental headless mode
- New workflows
result.name: Interactive PlantSeg with napari viewer

result.description:
- Config file is validate before pipeline start and additional sanity checks have been added.
- Errors are now more human friendly.
- New Meristem 3D/2D models available.
- Several bug fixes.
- clean conda recipe
